page.title: 13Broome Place,Broome,Norfolk
page.content: Has been described as Jacobian Mansion and is believed to have been built in l7OO by local architect for High Sheriff of Norfolk.The house was less than half its present size,having two floors, 4 dormers in roof & main ent- rance with arched porch looking down slope to road.In l898 development in- cluded a new wing, second floor grand staircase dividing into gallery,large leaded glass window in N.wall, court- yard, new drive, Victorian conserva- tory,landscaped grounds,formal gardens pond.Victorian potting shed still to be seen.The property has mains elec- tricity, its own drainage & water sup- ply from a deep bore sunk in l887 by Isler & Co.There is also a well sunk in l94O.Owner in l898 Mr E.H.T.de Poix JP and presently Lt.Col.& Mrs.G.P.Bol who came from Holland.
